intro: Petrophile pilostyla subsp. austrina, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Petrophile, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. This subspecies typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. It is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall. The plant plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
